definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: American abhorrence of Japanese military culture was hardly standard racism.
sentences.chinese: 美国对日本军国主义的厌恶不能算进种族主义范畴。

sentences.english: Some reports called it “militaristic”, but that is too flattering.
sentences.chinese: 有些报道称它为“军国主义的”，但那也太抬举它了。

sentences.english: He sees the war dead as victims of Japan's own militarism.
sentences.chinese: 他认为战役者是日本自身军国主义的受害者。

sentences.english: The key point of the worship is negating history and justifying Japan's military aggression.
sentences.chinese: 而参拜靖国神社就是为了把军国主义侵略史正当化。

sentences.english: Yasukuni Shrine is the spiritual pillar of Japanese militarist aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖国神社是日本军国主义对外侵略扩张的精神支柱。

sentences.english: The Japanese militarism has become the shackle of the relationship between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日本军国主义已经成为中日两国关系发展中的桎梏。

sentences.english: Japanese militarism once caused the very grave disaster to Asian people.
sentences.chinese: 日本军国主义曾经给人类带来惨绝人寰的灾难。

sentences.english: He believed that the whole country of Japan had been on the way to militarization.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，日本整个国家都已走向军国主义化。

sentences.english: Section three expounds the militarism of Northern Zhou.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分论述了西魏北周的军国主义特色。

sentences.english: The guilt for the war, therefore, rests at the door of German militarism and its leaders.
sentences.chinese: 因此，战祸应该归咎于德国军国主义及其领导人。

sentences.english: Yasuguni Shrine has become a spiritual pillar of Japanese militarists' policy of aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖国神社是日本军国主义对外侵略扩张的精神支柱。

sentences.english: All these indicate the wild ambition of Japanese Fascist militarism arid the confusion of right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 这些足见日本法西斯军国主义的狼子野心和颠倒是非。

sentences.english: First, the central concept of Japanese militarism ideology is the aggression ideology.
sentences.chinese: 首先，日本军国主义思想的核心是侵略扩张思想。

pinyin: guo2 jia1 she4 hui4 zhu3 yi4

definition: to invade China (referring to 19th century imperialist powers and Japan)
Great East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, Japanese wartime slogan for their short-lived Pacific Empire, first enunciated by Prime Minister Prince KONOE Fumimaro 近衛文麿|近卫文麿 in 1938
pinyin: Da4 Dong1 ya4 Gong4 rong2 quan1

definition: Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
to abandon the old (Asian) ways and learn from Europe/refers to the ideas that led to the Meiji Restoration and Japan's subsequent colonization projects in Asia
